bug.short_desc: Handle close event on the window

long_desc.thetext: It would be great if Qooxdoo could support the "close" event on the window, I mean an event that is fired when the user closes the window. For example in Stackoverflow when you write a question and then close the page before posting it, a dialog box is shown. The same thing could be done in Qooxdoo and it could be managed like any other event attachment.

Please see the following API: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/apiviewer/#qx.application.IApplication~close
Just as you add code to the main() method to setup your app, you would add code to the close() method that returned a string with the message to appear in a dialog (sandwiched between browser-specific, unmodifiable messages). I'll close this report as invalid.
